result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With credit for FIFTY (50) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,  and supervision fees AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION ON 15CM3138 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITHOUT TAX INTERCEPT.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
With credit for FIVE (5) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: corrected to show BOTH warrant fees, $70.00

2nd correction per MY clerical error-code "CN" for nonpayment penalty now also showing on count two assessments as should be, and ANOTHER "warrant" found in file, now also added.  JOC/assessment form transferred to DOC.
showing "warrant fee".

Per clerical error/previous closer.  Plea date now fixed; code "CN" now entered for nonpayment penalty, and "warrant fee" of $35 now entered.
Assessment form/JOC transmitted electronically to DOC.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as Interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant (Defendant's statement read by Counsel).

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FIVE (5) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIFTY (50) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FIFTY (50) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,  and supervision fees AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION ON 15CM3138 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITHOUT TAX INTERCEPT.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.
Adjourned to 11-30-2015.  Filed, sdg.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with St. Vincent Depaul Meal Program, 931 W Madison, Milwaukee, WI
Sworn as interpreter: Vickie Bermudez

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defense does not have an explanation as to Defendant's whereabouts.  State requests lift of stay on Warrant.  Court LIFTS stay on Warrant.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Attorney Eichenlaub reports that Defendant is in the Emergency Room.  State does NOT oppose an imposed and STAYED Warrant.  Defendant to provide proof of Hospitalization.  Calendar call scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant has pending charges.  Defendant has not been fully compliant with Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Court orders case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew  Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant did attended the UCC intake appointment and has begun therapy.  Defendant will also begin individual therapy.  Defense has not received any test results.  Monitoring agency was preveously changed to UCC.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.

Defendant will begin treatment at UCC on 7/8/2015.  Agreement to restart from today's date.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant has provided counsel with a stable telephone number.  Counsel has met with client and has an intake appointment scheduled.  Review hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

CASE RECALLED.

Defendant is requesting a brief adjournment to get client enrolled at UCC.  Review hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant had an Impact assessment.  Counsel has not been able to get in contact with the defendant to have a release signed.  Case passed.  Court to contact JusticePoint.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Colin McGinn for attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.    Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.

Defendant has an assessment scheduled at Impact on 5/19/2015.  Review hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Dawn Maldonado, interpreter, sworn-in.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court approves the agreement.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint and STAYS a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders case 15cm536 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.  Review hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Jesica Ballenger for Ann Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense waives interpreter for today's date.  Case may be resolved with a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant needs to be evaluated.  He will be going to Justice Point today.  If they cannot do the evaluation today, the next available date will be March 19th.  Defendant also has a case pending in Br. 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney .  Kevin Shomin for Ann Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Brenda Bartholomew, interpreter, sworn-in.  Defendant has a pending case in Br. 37.  Defense would like time for negotiations for possible global resolution. Defendant Johnathan Rivera-Ojeda in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with St. Vincent De Paul Meal Program at 931 W Madison Street, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
